content:
You can schedule YouTube videos to watch later using various methods. Here are a few:

1. **YouTube Watch Later**: YouTube has a built-in "Watch Later" feature. To use it:
	* Click the clock icon on a video thumbnail or below the video title.
	* Select "Watch Later" from the dropdown menu.
	* Go to your YouTube account, click on your profile picture, and select "Watch Later" from the dropdown menu.
	* You'll see a list of videos you've saved to watch later. You can also organize them into playlists.
2. **YouTube Notifications**: You can set up notifications for new videos from your favorite channels. To do this:
	* Go to the channel's page and click the bell icon.
	* Select "Notifications" from the dropdown menu.
	* Choose how you want to be notified (e.g., via email, mobile app, or browser).
	* You can customize your notification settings to receive notifications at a specific time, like 8 pm, to remind you to watch videos.
3. **Third-party browser extensions or apps**: There are several browser extensions and apps that allow you to schedule YouTube videos to watch later. Some popular options include:
	* **VideoLater**: A Chrome extension that lets you schedule videos to watch later and receive reminders.
	* **TubeBuddy**: A browser extension that offers a "Watch Later" feature, as well as other productivity tools for YouTube.
	* **WatchLater**: A mobile app (iOS and Android) that allows you to schedule YouTube videos and receive reminders.
4. **Calendar reminders**: You can also set reminders using your calendar app (e.g., Google Calendar, Apple Calendar). Simply create an event for your desired watch time (e.g., 8 pm) and add a note with the video title or link.

While these methods don't allow you to schedule videos to play automatically at a specific time, they can help you remember to watch them during your preferred time slot.
